table.name: external.apassdr9
table.description: The AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey - Data Release 9 This publication makes use of data products from the AAVSO Photometric All Sky Survey (APASS). Funded by the Robert Martin Ayers Sciences Fund and the National Science Foundation. Original catalogue released by Henden et al. 2015 AAS Meeting #225, id.336.16. Data retrieved using the VizieR catalogue access tool, CDS, Strasbourg, France. The original description of the VizieR service was published in A&AS 143, 23. VizieR catalogue II/336.

column.name: recno
column.description: Record number assigned by the VizieR team. Should Not be used for identification. However, the lack of a unique ID in APASS has made the VizieR recno the de-facto source identifier. For instance, it is used as such in the Gaia DR2 cross-match tables.

column.name: raj2000
column.description: Right ascension in decimal degrees (J2000)

column.name: dej2000
column.description: Declination in decimal degrees (J2000)

column.name: e_ra
column.description: [0/2.4] RA uncertainty

column.name: e_dec
column.description: [0/2.4] DEC uncertainty

column.name: nobs
column.description: [2/387] Number of observed nights

column.name: mobs
column.description: [2/3476] Number of images for this field, usually nobs*5

column.name: b_v
column.description: [-7.5/13]? B-V color index

column.name: e_b_v
column.description: [0/10.1]? B-V uncertainty

column.name: vmag
column.description: [5.5/27.4]? Johnson V-band magnitude

column.name: e_vmag
column.description: [0/7]? Vmag uncertainty

column.name: u_e_vmag
column.description: [0/1]? Uncertainty flag on e_Vmag (1)

column.name: bmag
column.description: [5.4/27.3]? Johnson B-band magnitude

column.name: e_bmag
column.description: [0/10]? Bmag uncertainty

column.name: u_e_bmag
column.description: [0/1]? Uncertainty flag on e_Bmag (1)

column.name: g_mag
column.description: [5.9/24.2]? g'-band AB magnitude, Sloan filter

column.name: e_g_mag
column.description: [0/9.7]? g'mag uncertainty

column.name: u_e_g_mag
column.description: [0/1]? Uncertainty flag on e_g'mag (1)

column.name: r_mag
column.description: [5.1/23.9]? r'-band AB magnitude, Sloan filter

column.name: e_r_mag
column.description: [0/6.5]? r'mag uncertainty

column.name: u_e_r_mag
column.description: [0/1]? Uncertainty flag on e_r'mag (1)

column.name: i_mag
column.description: [4.2/29.1]? i'-band AB magnitude, Sloan filter

column.name: e_i_mag
column.description: [0/9.6]? i'mag uncertainty

column.name: u_e_i_mag
column.description: [0/1]? Uncertainty flag on e_i'mag (1)

table.name: external.catwise2020
table.description: The CatWISE2020 Catalogue consists of 1,890,715,640 sources over the entire sky selected from Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE) and NEOWISE survey data at 3.4 and 4.6 micrometer (W1 and W2) collected from 7 January 2010 to 13 December 2018. This data set adds two years to that used for the CatWISE Preliminary Catalogue (Eisenhardt+, 2020ApJS..247...69E, 2020ApJS..247...69E), bringing the total to six times as many exposures spanning over sixteen times as large a time baseline as the AllWISE catalogue. The other major change from the CatWISE Preliminary Catalogue is that the detection list for the CatWISE2020 Catalogue was generated using "crowdsource" software (Schlafly+, 2019ApJS..240...30S, 2019ApJS..240...30S), while the CatWISE Preliminary Catalogue used the detection software used for AllWISE. These two factors result in roughly twice as many sources in the CatWISE2020 Catalogue. The 90% completeness depth for the CatWISE2020 Catalogue is at W1 = 17.7 mag and W2 = 17.5 mag, 1.7 mag deeper than in the CatWISE Preliminary Catalogue. This table has been created in May 2023 based on the VizieR version of the CatWISE2020 Catalogue (see https://vizier.cfa.harvard.edu/viz-bin/VizieR?-source=II/365). The corrections to the astrometry (positions and proper motions) identified in Marocco+ (2021ApJS..253....8M) have been included by CDS/VizieR and are therefore also included in this table.

column.name: obj_id
column.description: Tile name + processing code + wphot index (source_id)

column.name: ra_icrs
column.description: Right ascension (ICRS) (1)

column.name: e_ra_icrs
column.description: [0/74.3] Uncertainty in ra (sigra)

column.name: de_icrs
column.description: Declination (ICRS) (1)

column.name: e_de_icrs
column.description: [0/83.3] Uncertainty in dec (sigdec)

column.name: name
column.description: Source name (JHHMMSS.ss+DDMMSS.s; <CWISE JHHMMSS.ss+DDMMSS.s> in Simbad) (source_name)

column.name: e_pos
column.description: [-25.7/44.2] Uncertainty cross-term (sigradec)

column.name: xpos
column.description: X-pixel coordinate in the unWISE full depth coadd (wx)

column.name: ypos
column.description: Y-pixel coordinate in the unWISE full depth coadd (wy)

column.name: sky_w1
column.description: [-98.2/4997]? Frame sky background value, band-1; in dn units (w1sky) (2)

column.name: e_sky_w1
column.description: [0.4/999]? Frame sky background value uncertainty; band-1 (w1sigsk) (2)

column.name: conf_w1
column.description: [0/999]? Frame sky confusion based on the UNC images; in dn units (w1conf) (2)

column.name: sky_w2
column.description: [-99/5000]? Frame sky background value, band-2; in dn (w2sky) (2)

column.name: e_sky_w2
column.description: [0.7/999]? Frame sky background value uncertainty; band-2 (w2sigsk) (2)

column.name: conf_w2
column.description: [0/999]? Frame sky confusion based on the UNC images; in dn units (w2conf) (2)

column.name: n_w1
column.description: [0/221]? Number of profile-fit flux measurements for source with SNR>=3, band 1 (w1NM)

column.name: m_w1
column.description: [0/221]? Number of profile-fit flux measurements for source, band-1 (w1M)

column.name: n_w2
column.description: [0/221]? Number of profile-fit flux measurements for source with SNR>=3, band-2 (w2NM)

column.name: m_w2
column.description: [0/221]? Number of profile-fit flux measurements for source, band-2 (w2M)

column.name: mjd
column.description: [55205/58465] Mean observation epoch (MeanObsMJD)

column.name: ra_pm_deg
column.description: Right ascension (ICRS) at Ep=2015.4 (ra_pm) (3)

column.name: e_ra_pm_deg
column.description: [1e-4/99.94]? Uncertainty in ra_pm (sigra_pm)

column.name: de_pm_deg
column.description: Declination (ICRS) at Ep=2015.4 (dec_pm) (3)

column.name: e_de_pm_deg
column.description: [0/99.8]? Uncertainty in dec_pm (sigdec_pm)

column.name: e_pos_pm
column.description: [-99.2/99.9]? Uncertainty cross-term (sigradec_pm)

column.name: pm_ra
column.description: [-100/100] Proper motion in ra (PMRA) (1)

column.name: e_pm_ra
column.description: [7e-4/1000] Uncertainty in PMRA (sigPMRA)

column.name: pm_de
column.description: [-100/100] Proper motion in dec (PMDec) (1)

column.name: e_pm_de
column.description: [7e-4/1000] Uncertainty in PMDec (sigPMDec)

column.name: snr_w1pm
column.description: [0/1000]? Flux S/N ratio; band-1 (w1snr_pm)

column.name: snr_w2pm
column.description: [0/1000]? Flux S/N ratio; band-2 (w2snr_pm)

column.name: fw1pm
column.description: [-1.2e8/2e14]? WPRO raw flux, band-1 (W1, 3.35um) in dn units (w1flux_pm)

column.name: e_fw1pm
column.description: [3.7e-4/3.5e12]? WPRO raw flux uncertainty; band-1 (w1sigflux_pm)

column.name: fw2pm
column.description: [-4.8e8/2e10]? WPRO raw flux, band-2 (W2, 4.6um); in dn units (w2flux_pm)

column.name: e_fw2pm
column.description: [1e-4/3.2e13]? Fit WPRO raw flux uncertainty; band-2 (w2sigflux_pm)

column.name: w1mpro_pm
column.description: [-10/27]? WPRO magnitude in band-1 (W1: 3.35um) (w1mpro_pm) (4)

column.name: e_w1mpro_pm
column.description: [0/0.6]? W1mproPM uncertainty (w1sigmpro_pm)

column.name: chi2_w1pm
column.description: [8.3e-7/6.4e21]? WPRO reduced chi^2^; band-1 (w1rchi2_pm)

column.name: w2mpro_pm
column.description: [-10/25.5]? WPRO magnitude in band-2 (W2: 4.6um) (w2mpro_pm) (4)

column.name: e_w2mpro_pm
column.description: [0/0.6]? W2mproPM uncertainty (w2sigmpro_pm)

column.name: chi2_w2pm
column.description: [2.6e-6/375600]? WPRO reduced chi^2^; band-2 (w2rchi2_pm)

column.name: chi2pm
column.description: [8.3e-7/92260]? Reduced chi squared; total (rchi2_pm)

column.name: pm_qual
column.description: Quality of the PM solution (pmcode) (5)

column.name: dist
column.description: [0/20]? Radial distance between apparitions (dist)

column.name: d_w1mpro
column.description: [-9.2/9.3]? W1mpro difference (dw1mag)

column.name: chi2d_w1mpro
column.description: [0/100]? Chi-square for dw1mag (1 DF) (rch2w1)

column.name: d_w2mpro
column.description: [-9.4/10.2]? W2mpro difference (dw2mag)

column.name: chi2d_w2mpro
column.description: [0/100]? Chi-square for dw2mag (1 DF) (rch2w2)

column.name: elon_avg
column.description: ? Averaged ecliptic longitude (elon_avg)

column.name: e_elon_avg
column.description: [0.001/1.6]? One-sigma uncertainty in elon (elonSig)

column.name: elat_avg
column.description: ? Averaged ecliptic latitude (elat_avg)

column.name: e_elat_avg
column.description: [0.001/1.7]? One-sigma uncertainty in elat (elatSig)

column.name: d_elon
column.description: ? Descending-ascending ecliptic longitude (Delon) (6)

column.name: e_d_elon
column.description: [0.001/101.5]? One-sigma uncertainty in Delon (DelonSig)

column.name: d_elat
column.description: ? Descending-ascending ecliptic latitude (Delat)

column.name: e_d_elat
column.description: [0.001/105.8]? One-sigma uncertainty in Delat (DelatSig)

column.name: snrd_elon
column.description: [0/1065]? |Delon|/DelonSig (DelonSNR)

column.name: snrd_elat
column.description: [0/475]? |Delat|/DelatSig (DelatSNR)

column.name: chi2pm_ra
column.description: [0/7.3e7]? Chi-square for PMRA difference (1 DF) (chi2pmra)

column.name: chi2pm_de
column.description: [0/2.2e8]? Chi-square for PMRA difference (1 DF) (chi2pmdec)

column.name: ka
column.description: [0123n] Astrometry usage code (7)

column.name: k1
column.description: [0123n] W1 photometry usage code (7)

column.name: k2
column.description: [0123n] W2 photometry usage code (7)

column.name: km
column.description: [0123n] Proper motion usage code (7)

column.name: plx1
column.description: [-831/569]? Parallax from PM desc-asce elon (par_pm)

column.name: e_plx1
column.description: [0.001/53]? One-sigma uncertainty in par_pm (par_pmSig)

column.name: plx2
column.description: [-831/504]? Parallax estimate from stationary solution (par_stat)

column.name: e_plx2
column.description: [0.001/189]? One-sigma uncertainty in par_stat (par_sigma)

column.name: sep
column.description: [0/2.75]? Distance between CatWISE and AllWISE source (dist_x)

column.name: ccf
column.description: [0DHOPdhop] Worst case 4 character cc_flag from AllWISE (cc_flags) (8)

column.name: abf
column.description: [0DHOP] Two character (W1 W2) artifact flag (ab_flags) (8)

table.name: external.gaiadr2_astrophysical_parameters
table.description:
Fouesneau et al. (2022) Gaia DR2 astrophysical parameters. "Astrophysical Parameters from Gaia DR2, 2MASS & AllWISE", Fouesneau et al., 2022, A&A (https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2022arXiv220103252F/abstract). Data replicated from the gdr2ap.main table at the GAVO Data Centre TAP service https://dc.g-vo.org/tap and TAP metadata as of January 2022.
Original table description: Stellar physical and dynamical properties are essential knowledge to understanding the structure, formation, and evolution of our Galaxy. We produced an all-sky uniformly derived catalog of stellar astrophysical parameters (APs; age, mass, temperature, bolometric luminosity, distance, dust extinction) to give insight into the physical properties of Milky-Way stars. Exploiting the power of multi-wavelength and multi-survey observations from Gaia DR2 parallaxes and integrated photometry along with 2MASS and AllWISE photometry, we introduce an all-sky uniformly derived catalog of stellar astrophysical parameters, including dust extinction (A0) and average grain size (R0) along the line of sight, for 123,076,271 stars. In contrast with previous works, we do not use a Galactic model as prior in our analysis. We validate our results against other literature (e.g., benchmark stars, interferometry, Bayestar, StarHorse). The limited optical information in the Gaia photometric bands or the lack of ultraviolet or spectroscopic information renders the chemistry inference prior dominated. We demonstrate that Gaia parallaxes bring sufficient leverage to explore the detailed structures of the interstellar medium in our Milky Way. In Gaia DR3, we will obtain the dispersed optical light information to break through some limitations of this analysis, allowing us to infer stellar chemistry in particular. Gaia promises us data to construct the most detailed view of the chemo-dynamics of field star populations in our Galaxy.

column.name: source_id
column.description: Unique source identifier. Note that this *cannot* be matched against the DR1 source_id.

column.name: a0_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the dust exctinction A₀ towards this source.

column.name: a0_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of dust exctinction A₀ towards this source.

column.name: a0_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the dust exctinction A₀ towards this source. In ADQL, write a0_dist[1] for the minimum, a0_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: r0_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the average dust grain size extinction parameter.

column.name: r0_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of average dust grain size extinction parameter.

column.name: r0_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the average dust grain size extinction parameter. In ADQL, write r0_dist[1] for the minimum, r0_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: loga_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log10 of the age.

column.name: loga_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log10 of the age.

column.name: loga_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log10 of the age. In ADQL, write loga_dist[1] for the minimum, loga_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: logl_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log10 of the luminosity.

column.name: logl_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log10 of the luminosity.

column.name: logl_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log10 of the luminosity. In ADQL, write logl_dist[1] for the minimum, logl_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: logm_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log10 of the mass.

column.name: logm_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log10 of the mass.

column.name: logm_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log10 of the mass. In ADQL, write logm_dist[1] for the minimum, logm_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: logt_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log10 of the effective temperature.

column.name: logt_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log10 of the effective temperature.

column.name: logt_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log10 of the effective temperature. In ADQL, write logt_dist[1] for the minimum, logt_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: logg_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log10 of the surface gravity.

column.name: logg_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log10 of the surface gravity.

column.name: logg_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log10 of the surface gravity. In ADQL, write logg_dist[1] for the minimum, logg_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: a_bp_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the attenuation in the Gaia BP band towards this source..

column.name: a_bp_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of attenuation in the Gaia BP band towards this source..

column.name: a_bp_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the attenuation in the Gaia BP band towards this source.. In ADQL, write a_bp_dist[1] for the minimum, a_bp_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: a_g_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the attenuation in the Gaia G band towards this source..

column.name: a_g_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of attenuation in the Gaia G band towards this source..

column.name: a_g_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the attenuation in the Gaia G band towards this source.. In ADQL, write a_g_dist[1] for the minimum, a_g_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: a_rp_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the attenuation in the Gaia RP band towards this source..

column.name: a_rp_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of attenuation in the Gaia RP band towards this source..

column.name: a_rp_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the attenuation in the Gaia RP band towards this source.. In ADQL, write a_rp_dist[1] for the minimum, a_rp_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_bp
column.description: Recalibrated Gaia BP magnitude.

column.name: err_bp
column.description: Recalibrated error from original Gaia BP magnitude.

column.name: bp_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the Gaia BP magnitude.

column.name: bp_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of Gaia BP magnitude.

column.name: bp_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the Gaia BP magnitude. In ADQL, write bp_dist[1] for the minimum, bp_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_g
column.description: Recalibrated Gaia G magnitude.

column.name: err_g
column.description: Recalibrated error from original Gaia G magnitude.

column.name: g_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the Gaia G magnitude.

column.name: g_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of Gaia G magnitude.

column.name: g_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the Gaia G magnitude. In ADQL, write g_dist[1] for the minimum, g_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_rp

column.name: err_rp
column.description: Recalibrated error from original Gaia RP magnitude.

column.name: rp_best

column.name: rp_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of Gaia RP magnitude.

column.name: rp_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the Gaia RP magnitude. In ADQL, write rp_dist[1] for the minimum, rp_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_j
column.description: Recalibrated 2MASS J magnitude.

column.name: err_j
column.description: Recalibrated error from original 2MASS J magnitude.

column.name: j_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the 2MASS J magnitude.

column.name: j_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of 2MASS J magnitude.

column.name: j_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the 2MASS J magnitude. In ADQL, write j_dist[1] for the minimum, j_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_h
column.description: Recalibrated 2MASS H magnitude.

column.name: err_h
column.description: Recalibrated error from original 2MASS H magnitude.

column.name: h_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the 2MASS H magnitude.

column.name: h_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of 2MASS H magnitude.

column.name: h_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the 2MASS H magnitude. In ADQL, write h_dist[1] for the minimum, h_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_ks
column.description: Recalibrated 2MASS Ks magnitude.

column.name: err_ks
column.description: Recalibrated error from original 2MASS Ks magnitude.

column.name: ks_best

column.name: ks_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of 2MASS Ks magnitude.

column.name: ks_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the 2MASS Ks magnitude. In ADQL, write ks_dist[1] for the minimum, ks_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_w1
column.description: Recalibrated WISE W1 magnitude.

column.name: err_w1
column.description: Recalibrated error from original WISE W1 magnitude.

column.name: w1_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the WISE W1 magnitude.

column.name: w1_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of WISE W1 magnitude.

column.name: w1_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the WISE W1 magnitude. In ADQL, write w1_dist[1] for the minimum, w1_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: mag_w2
column.description: Recalibrated WISE W2 magnitude.

column.name: err_w2
column.description: Recalibrated error from original WISE W2 magnitude.

column.name: w2_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the WISE W2 magnitude.

column.name: w2_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of WISE W2 magnitude.

column.name: w2_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the WISE W2 magnitude. In ADQL, write w2_dist[1] for the minimum, w2_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: dmod_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the distance modulus.

column.name: dmod_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of distance modulus.

column.name: dmod_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the distance modulus. In ADQL, write dmod_dist[1] for the minimum, dmod_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: lnlike_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log likelihood of the solution (paper Eq. 1).

column.name: lnlike_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log likelihood of the solution (paper Eq. 1).

column.name: lnlike_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log likelihood of the solution (paper Eq. 1). In ADQL, write lnlike_dist[1] for the minimum, lnlike_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: lnp_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log posterior of the solution (paper Eq. 2).

column.name: lnp_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log posterior of the solution (paper Eq. 2).

column.name: lnp_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log posterior of the solution (paper Eq. 2). In ADQL, write lnp_dist[1] for the minimum, lnp_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: log10jitter_best
column.description: multivariate maximum posterior estimate for the log photometric likelihood jitter common to all bands.

column.name: log10jitter_p50
column.description: median of the distribution of log photometric likelihood jitter common to all bands.

column.name: log10jitter_dist
column.description: Distribution (min, p16, p25, p50, p75, p84, max) of the log photometric likelihood jitter common to all bands. In ADQL, write log10jitter_dist[1] for the minimum, log10jitter_dist[2] for the 16th percentile, and so on.

column.name: parallax
column.description: Recalibrated parallax.

column.name: err_parallax
column.description: Error in recalibrated parallax.
